revised_title: Anniversary Address: Scientific Achievements and Losses in 1913
tldr: In his 1913 Anniversary Address, Sir Archibald Geikie reflects on the scientific achievements and losses of the year. He mourns the passing of George Howard Darwin, a brilliant scientist who contributed significantly to the study of tides and the history of Earth. He also highlights the accomplishments of other notable scientists, including John Milne, a pioneer in seismology, and Sir William White, an expert in engineering and naval architecture. The address celebrates the dedication and contributions of these individuals to various fields of science.
